snippet: The Treasury Department’s Office of Foreign Assets Control said seven commercial ships had been blocked by its action, cutting off a potential fuel source to Assad’s military.
abstract: Treasury Department officials sanction seven overseas companies and four individuals for trying to evade American and European Union restrictions on fuel imports to Syria designed to block keep fuel out of hands of Pres Bashar al-Assad’s military.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department’s Office of Foreign Assets Control said seven commercial ships had been blocked by its action, cutting off a potential fuel source to Assad’s military.

headline.print_headline: Middle East; Syria: U.S. Sets New Sanctions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of Foreign Assets Control (United States Treasury)
